content.text:
# Yangtze civilization

, grown since the 9th millennium BC]]
(3400–2600 BC)]]
Yangtze civilization () is a generic name for various ancient Neolithic and Bronze Age cultures from the Yangtze basin in China, a contemporary civilization by the neighboring Yellow River civilization.
Cultures
Upper Yangtze
*Pengtoushan culture (7000–6100 BCE)
*Daxi culture (5000–3000 BCE)
*Qujialing culture (3400–2600 BCE)
*Shijiahe culture (2500–2000 BCE)
Lower Yangtze
*Hemudu culture (5500–3300 BCE)
*Majiabang culture  (5000–3300 BCE)
*Songze culture (3800–3300 BCE)
*Liangzhu culture (3300–2300 BCE)
*Wucheng culture (1600 BCE–?)
See also
*Yellow river civilization
*Liao civilization
*Prehistory of China
References
